title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 15 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 15.

questions.question: Who did David say ought to carry the ark of God?
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:2 states that David said none ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites, as the LORD had chosen them for this task.

questions.question: Where did David gather all Israel to bring up the ark of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Jerusalem
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 15:3, David gathered all Israel together to Jerusalem to bring up the ark.

questions.question: Who was the chief of the sons of Kohath?
questions.correctAnswer: Uriel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:5 identifies Uriel as the chief of the sons of Kohath.

questions.question: How many brethren did Asaiah have among the sons of Merari?
questions.correctAnswer: Two hundred and twenty
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:6 states that Asaiah was the chief of the sons of Merari, and his brethren were two hundred and twenty.

questions.question: What did David tell the Levites to do before bringing up the ark of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctify yourselves
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 15:12, David instructs the Levites to sanctify themselves before bringing up the ark.

questions.question: Why did the LORD make a breach upon Israel when they first tried to bring up the ark?
options: They sought Him not after the due order
They did not prepare a tent
questions.correctAnswer: They sought Him not after the due order
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:13 explains that the LORD made a breach upon them because they did not seek Him according to the proper order.

questions.question: According to the chapter, how were the Levites carrying the ark of God?
options: Upon their shoulders with the staves
By dragging it on the ground
questions.correctAnswer: Upon their shoulders with the staves
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:15 says the Levites bore the ark upon their shoulders with the staves as commanded by Moses.

questions.question: Who was appointed chief of the Levites for song?
questions.correctAnswer: Chenaniah
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:22 states that Chenaniah was the chief of the Levites for song because he was skilful.

questions.question: Which instruments were used by the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan?
questions.correctAnswer: Cymbals of brass
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:19 notes that the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan sounded with cymbals of brass.

questions.question: Who were the doorkeepers for the ark mentioned in the chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Berechiah and Elkanah
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:23 identifies Berechiah and Elkanah as doorkeepers for the ark.

questions.question: True or False: David wore a robe of fine linen when bringing up the ark of the covenant.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 15:27, David was clothed with a robe of fine linen during the procession.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites brought up the ark of the covenant with shouting and music.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:28 describes the ark being brought up with shouting and the sound of various musical instruments.

questions.question: True or False: Michal, daughter of Saul, was pleased when she saw David dancing before the ark.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:29 shows that Michal despised David in her heart when she saw him dancing.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Chronicles 15:1: 'And David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: tent
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:1 states that David pitched a tent for the ark of God.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Chronicles 15:26: 'And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they offered seven ______ and seven rams.'
questions.correctAnswer: bullocks
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:26 says the Levites offered seven bullocks and seven rams.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 15 teach us about obedience in serving God, especially in leadership roles?
options: Only Levites should carry the ark because God chose them for this service
Any Israelite can carry the ark if they are willing
Only priests can carry the ark regardless of tribe
The king should carry the ark as a sign of authority
questions.correctAnswer: Only Levites should carry the ark because God chose them for this service
questions.explanation: Verse 1 Chronicles 15:2 clearly states that only Levites are to carry the ark because the LORD chose them to minister to Him forever. This teaches us to obey God's instructions about roles in ministry, reflecting faithfulness and respect for His order. Other verses such as 15:15 and 15:13 emphasize the importance of following God's prescribed order to avoid His displeasure.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with discouragement after failing in a ministry task. Based on 1 Chronicles 15, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God’s favor can be restored when we sanctify ourselves and obey His instructions
Failure means God has abandoned us permanently
We should quit and not attempt again
Success depends only on human effort
questions.correctAnswer: God’s favor can be restored when we sanctify ourselves and obey His instructions
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:12-14 teaches that David told the Levites to sanctify themselves to carry the ark properly after a previous failure. Verse 13 explains God made a breach because they did not seek Him according to the due order, but sanctification and obedience led to restoration. This encourages perseverance and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about the importance of worship and joy in serving God?
options: Serving God should be accompanied by joyful singing and music
Worship should be solemn and without instruments
Music is optional and not important in worship
Only priests are allowed to sing in worship
questions.correctAnswer: Serving God should be accompanied by joyful singing and music
questions.explanation: Verses 1 Chronicles 15:16-22 describe David appointing Levites as singers and musicians to joyfully praise God with instruments and singing. This shows that joyful worship is an essential part of honoring God and serving Him with gladness.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 15 teach about humility and proper preparation before serving God?
options: Sanctification and seeking God’s order are necessary before service
We can serve God any way we want without preparation
Humility is not required if we have good intentions
Only physical strength matters in serving
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctification and seeking God’s order are necessary before service
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:12-13 highlights that David told the Levite leaders to sanctify themselves so they could bring up the ark properly. The earlier failure and God’s displeasure came from not seeking Him in the due order. This stresses humility, preparation, and respect for God’s instructions.

questions.question: How can a believer apply the example of David’s leadership in 1 Chronicles 15 to their work ethic and integrity?
options: David took careful steps to prepare the ark’s transportation and appointed leaders carefully
David ignored the roles of others and did everything himself
David relied on luck for success
questions.correctAnswer: David took careful steps to prepare the ark’s transportation and appointed leaders carefully
questions.explanation: Throughout 1 Chronicles 15, David carefully prepares by making houses and tents (verse 1), gathering the right people (verses 4-11), and appointing musicians and doorkeepers (verses 16-24). This teaches the importance of planning, integrity, and diligence in work and leadership.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 15, David wore a robe of fine linen and an ephod of linen when bringing up the ark.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 1 Chronicles 15:27 specifically states that David was clothed with a robe of fine linen and had an ephod of linen upon him. This symbolizes reverence and holiness in worship.

questions.question: True or False: Michal, daughter of Saul, rejoiced and praised David for his dance before the ark according to 1 Chronicles 15.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:29 shows that Michal despised David in her heart when she saw him dancing and playing before the ark. This illustrates how attitudes towards worship can differ and the importance of sincere devotion.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 15 teach about stewardship and giving in response to God’s help?
options: Offering sacrifices of thanks after God’s help is appropriate
God’s help requires no response from us
We should keep all blessings for ourselves
questions.correctAnswer: Offering sacrifices of thanks after God’s help is appropriate
questions.explanation: Verse 1 Chronicles 15:26 states that when God helped the Levites carry the ark, they offered seven bullocks and seven rams as a sacrifice. This shows gratitude and stewardship through giving back to God.

questions.question: A believer is feeling unworthy to serve in church leadership. Based on 1 Chronicles 15, what encouragement can you share?
options: God chooses and appoints leaders according to His will and calls, regardless of feelings
Service is only for a select few by human decision
questions.correctAnswer: God chooses and appoints leaders according to His will and calls, regardless of feelings
questions.explanation: Verses 5-10 list the appointed leaders of Levite families whom God chose for specific roles. This shows that leadership is a divine calling, not based on human merit or feelings, encouraging believers to trust God’s calling.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 15 emphasize the value of community and fellowship in worship?
options: All Israel gathered together with joy to bring up the ark
Worship should be private and individual only
Only priests and kings need to worship together
questions.correctAnswer: All Israel gathered together with joy to bring up the ark
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 25 show David gathered all Israel to bring up the ark with joy and celebration. This demonstrates the importance of collective worship and fellowship in serving God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David prepared a _______ for the ark of God in the city of David.
questions.correctAnswer: tent
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:1 states that David prepared a place and pitched a tent for the ark of God. This shows careful preparation and respect for God’s presence.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance through trials does 1 Chronicles 15 provide?
options: If we fail initially, we should sanctify ourselves and try again according to God's order
Failure means we should give up completely
We should ignore God's instructions and try new methods
questions.correctAnswer: If we fail initially, we should sanctify ourselves and try again according to God's order
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 show that after failing to carry the ark properly the first time, David told the Levites to sanctify themselves and obey God’s order, leading to successful worship. This encourages perseverance and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does this chapter illustrate the importance of family and generational involvement in serving God?
options: David gathered entire families and their descendants for specific roles in worship
Only individuals acting alone serve God
Service is only for the eldest generation
questions.correctAnswer: David gathered entire families and their descendants for specific roles in worship
questions.explanation: Verses 5-10 list chiefs of Levite families and their brethren who served together, showing how family groups participated in worship and ministry. This highlights the value of family involvement in spiritual service.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 15, what role did song and music play in leading others to worship God?
options: Music and singing were used to lead with joy and praise before the ark
Music was used only to entertain
Singing was discouraged in public worship
questions.correctAnswer: Music and singing were used to lead with joy and praise before the ark
questions.explanation: Verses 16-22 describe David appointing singers and musicians with instruments to lead joyful worship, showing music as a powerful means to praise God and encourage the community.

questions.question: How does the example of David’s rejoicing before God in 1 Chronicles 15 encourage humility and gratitude in family life?
options: David openly expressed joy before God without pride, teaching us to worship with a humble and grateful heart
Rejoicing before God should be private and hidden
Pride is acceptable if expressing joy
Gratitude is only shown through words, not actions
questions.correctAnswer: David openly expressed joy before God without pride, teaching us to worship with a humble and grateful heart
questions.explanation: Verse 29 shows David dancing before the ark, expressing joy and gratitude openly, despite Michal's criticism. This encourages humble and heartfelt worship in family and community life.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 15.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 15, why did David insist that only the Levites should carry the ark of God?
options: Because the Levites were chosen by the LORD to carry the ark and minister to Him forever
Because they were the strongest tribe
Because they lived closest to the ark
Because David was a Levite himself
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Levites were chosen by the LORD to carry the ark and minister to Him forever
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:2 states that David said none ought to carry the ark but the Levites, for the LORD had chosen them to carry the ark and minister forever, reflecting the divine appointment of the Levites.

questions.question: Which of the following Levite family leaders was NOT mentioned as chief over his brethren in 1 Chronicles 15?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:5-10 lists chiefs of various Levite families, including Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, but Moses is not mentioned here as a chief, though he was historically the one who gave instructions regarding the ark.

questions.question: What was the reason given for the initial failure to bring up the ark according to the due order, as explained by David?
options: The people sought God not after the due order
The Levites were not properly sanctified
questions.correctAnswer: The people sought God not after the due order
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 15:13, David explains that the LORD made a breach upon them because they sought Him not after the due order, highlighting the importance of following divine instructions carefully.

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 15, what musical instruments were appointed to be used by the Levite singers during the procession?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalteries, harps, and cymbals
questions.explanation: Verse 16 indicates David instructed the Levites to appoint singers with instruments of music, specifically psalteries, harps, and cymbals, reflecting the detailed liturgical practice.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the chief singer and instructor of the song in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Chenaniah
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:22 names Chenaniah as the chief of the Levites for song, who instructed about the song because he was skillful, indicating his leadership in worship music.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about the Levites who carried the ark according to 1 Chronicles 15?
options: They carried the ark on their shoulders with staves as commanded by Moses
They were priests and Levites who sanctified themselves
They used a cart to transport the ark
They wore fine linen robes during the procession
questions.correctAnswer: They used a cart to transport the ark
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states the Levites carried the ark on their shoulders with staves as Moses commanded; earlier attempts using a cart had failed (cf. 2 Samuel 6), so this was corrected here.

questions.question: The procession bringing the ark to the city of David involved several groups. Which group is NOT mentioned as participating in the music and praise?
questions.correctAnswer: Dancers
questions.explanation: While David himself danced (v29), the groups explicitly mentioned in the procession are singers, trumpeters, and doorkeepers (vv24, 28), but dancers are not listed as part of the appointed procession.

questions.question: What was the significance of David wearing a robe of fine linen and an ephod of linen as he brought up the ark?
options: It symbolized priestly purity and joyful worship
It was a mark of royal authority over Israel
It identified him as a Levite
It was a sign of mourning
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolized priestly purity and joyful worship
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:27 shows David clothed in fine linen and an ephod, garments associated with priestly service and purity, emphasizing his role in worship and humility before God.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 15, the ark of the covenant was brought up from the house of Obededom with joy and accompanied by animal offerings.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 25 and 26 indicate that David and leaders brought up the ark from Obededom’s house with joy, and the Levites offered seven bullocks and seven rams, showing celebration and sacrifice.

questions.question: What does the role of the doorkeepers, as mentioned in 1 Chronicles 15, suggest about the worship setting?
options: They guarded the ark and regulated access to the worship area
questions.correctAnswer: They guarded the ark and regulated access to the worship area
questions.explanation: Verses 18 and 23-24 mention doorkeepers like Berechiah and Elkanah, whose role was to guard the ark and control access, emphasizing sacred space management in ancient Israelite worship.

questions.question: How does the detailed listing of Levite families and their leaders in 1 Chronicles 15 reflect the historical and cultural context of ancient Israel?
options: It demonstrates the organized tribal system and the importance of lineage in religious duties
It shows that only one family was responsible for all worship duties
It indicates the Levites were a recent addition to Israel
It suggests David invented the Levite priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates the organized tribal system and the importance of lineage in religious duties
questions.explanation: The enumeration in verses 5-10 reflects the ancient Near Eastern emphasis on tribal lineage and hereditary roles, especially for the Levites chosen for specific worship tasks.

questions.question: What literary function does the narrative of Michal despising David for dancing (verse 29) serve in the context of the chapter?
options: It provides a contrast between human judgment and joyful worship of God
It explains a reason why the ark was moved
It shows David's failure as king
questions.correctAnswer: It provides a contrast between human judgment and joyful worship of God
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:29 contrasts Michal's disdain with David’s exuberant worship, illustrating themes of sincere devotion versus external criticism, relevant in the broader biblical theme of inner worship.

questions.question: The instruction that the ark be carried on the shoulders of the Levites with staves 'as Moses commanded' (verse 15) serves as a typological connection to which earlier biblical event?
options: The Exodus and the instructions for the tabernacle transport
The giving of the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: The Exodus and the instructions for the tabernacle transport
questions.explanation: Verse 15 recalls Moses’ instructions in Exodus for how the ark was to be transported during the wilderness journey, linking David's actions to the foundational covenant event.

questions.question: Which theme prominent in 1 Chronicles 15 is further developed throughout the Old Testament concerning the ark of God?
options: The holiness of God and the necessity of proper worship
The political power of the monarchy
questions.correctAnswer: The holiness of God and the necessity of proper worship
questions.explanation: The chapter emphasizes sanctification and correct procedures (vv12-14), consistent with broader biblical themes about God's holiness requiring reverent worship.

questions.question: How does the role of the priests and Levites in 1 Chronicles 15 reflect the author’s intent for his post-exilic audience?
options: To encourage restoration of proper worship and temple service after exile
To promote a new religious system without priests
To focus solely on David’s kingship
questions.correctAnswer: To encourage restoration of proper worship and temple service after exile
questions.explanation: The Chronicler, writing post-exile, highlights the Levites' sanctification and proper worship (vv12-14), likely to inspire the community to restore temple worship faithfully.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 15, why did David insist that only the Levites should carry the ark of God?
options: Because the LORD had chosen them to carry the ark and minister to Him forever
Because the Levites were the strongest tribe
Because David wanted to honor his own tribe
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD had chosen them to carry the ark and minister to Him forever
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:2 states clearly that David said none ought to carry the ark but the Levites, for the LORD had chosen them to carry the ark and minister to Him forever. This shows God's sovereign choice of the Levites for this holy task. Similarly, Numbers 1:50-53 and Deuteronomy 10:8 affirm the Levites' special role, while Hebrews 7:23-24 points to the eternal priesthood fulfilled in Christ.

questions.question: What was the consequence mentioned in 1 Chronicles 15 for not seeking God according to the due order when transporting the ark?
options: The LORD made a breach upon Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD made a breach upon Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:13 explains that because the people did not carry the ark according to the prescribed order, the LORD made a breach upon them. This teaches the holiness of God and the necessity of obedience in approaching Him. This principle is echoed in Exodus 28:43, 2 Samuel 6:6-7 where Uzzah was struck down, and Hebrews 12:28-29 which calls for reverence before a consuming fire.

questions.question: Who were appointed by David as singers with musical instruments during the procession of the ark?
questions.correctAnswer: Heman, Asaph, and Ethan
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:17 and 19 show that Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were appointed as singers with cymbals and instruments. Their role highlights the importance of worship and praise in approaching God, consistent with Psalms 50:1-6 and 1 Chronicles 16:4-6. This also prefigures the New Testament emphasis on worship in spirit and truth (John 4:23).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a ______.
questions.correctAnswer: tent
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:1 states David prepared a place for the ark and pitched a tent for it. This points to the transitional phase before the permanent temple, underscoring God's presence dwelling among His people. This is consistent with Exodus 26:1 (Tabernacle as a tent), and the New Testament concept of God dwelling in believers (2 Corinthians 6:16).

questions.question: Which tribe’s chiefs and brethren did David assemble to bring up the ark of the LORD?
options: The children of Aaron and the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Aaron and the Levites
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:4 shows David assembled the children of Aaron and the Levites, emphasizing the priestly and Levitical roles in worship. This reflects God's appointment of the priestly tribe for holy service (Exodus 28:1; Numbers 3:5-10), foundational for Israel’s covenant relationship (Hebrews 7:11-17).

questions.question: What was the specific instruction regarding how the ark of God was to be carried by the Levites?
options: Upon their shoulders with staves as Moses commanded
In a chariot drawn by horses
By dragging it on the ground
Carried on the backs of animals
questions.correctAnswer: Upon their shoulders with staves as Moses commanded
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:15 states the Levites bore the ark on their shoulders with staves, following Moses’ command (Exodus 25:14-15). This shows obedience to divine ordinances and the holiness of the ark. Hebrews 9:4 references the ark’s carrying poles, emphasizing continuity in God’s instructions.

questions.question: Who was the chief of the Levites responsible for instructing about the song during the procession?
questions.correctAnswer: Chenaniah
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:22 identifies Chenaniah as the chief of the Levites responsible for instructing about the song because he was skillful. This demonstrates the importance of order and excellence in worship, paralleling the role of musicians in temple worship (Psalm 33:3) and the New Testament call for orderly worship (1 Corinthians 14:40).

questions.question: What did David and the elders of Israel do as they brought up the ark of the covenant from the house of Obededom?
questions.correctAnswer: They went with joy
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:25 states David and the elders went to bring up the ark with joy, highlighting worship as a joyful act before God (Psalm 100:1-2). This joy reflects the New Testament teaching on rejoicing in the presence of the Lord (Philippians 4:4).

questions.question: Which garments did David wear when bringing up the ark of the covenant according to 1 Chronicles 15?
options: A robe of fine linen and an ephod of linen
questions.correctAnswer: A robe of fine linen and an ephod of linen
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:27 notes David was clothed with a robe of fine linen and an ephod of linen, garments associated with priestly service, indicating his role in worship and humility before God. This aligns with priestly vestments in Exodus 28 and points typologically to Christ as our great High Priest (Hebrews 4:14-16).

questions.question: What was the reaction of Michal, daughter of Saul, when she saw King David dancing before the ark?
options: She despised him in her heart
questions.correctAnswer: She despised him in her heart
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:29 records that Michal despised David in her heart for dancing before the ark. This contrasts worldly attitudes toward worship with biblical joy in God’s presence, showing human pride versus true humility (Psalm 149:3-4; Luke 15:25-32).

questions.question: Which two priests did David call upon to join the Levites in sanctifying themselves for bringing up the ark?
questions.correctAnswer: Zadok and Abiathar
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:11 says David called Zadok and Abiathar the priests to join the Levites in sanctification for bringing up the ark. This shows the importance of priestly leadership in corporate worship (Leviticus 8:6; Hebrews 5:1-4).

questions.question: What did the Levites offer after God helped them bear the ark of the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven bullocks and seven rams
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:26 describes the Levites offering seven bullocks and seven rams in thanksgiving after God helped them. This sacrificial offering reflects Old Testament principles of thanksgiving and covenant renewal (Leviticus 9:1-5; Psalm 50:14; Hebrews 13:15).

questions.question: Which of the following groups were appointed as doorkeepers for the ark?
questions.correctAnswer: Berechiah, Elkanah, Obededom, and Jehiah
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:23 and 24 identify Berechiah and Elkanah as doorkeepers, with Obededom and Jehiah also serving as doorkeepers for the ark. This underscores the order and sanctity surrounding God's presence (1 Chronicles 9:17-27; Nehemiah 12:25; John 10:9-10).

questions.question: What musical instruments were used by the Levites during the procession of the ark according to 1 Chronicles 15?
options: Psalteries, harps, cymbals, trumpets, and cornet
questions.correctAnswer: Psalteries, harps, cymbals, trumpets, and cornet
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:16 and 28 lists psalteries, harps, cymbals, trumpets, and cornet as instruments used in joyful worship. This variety reflects the biblical emphasis on diverse musical praise (Psalm 150; 2 Chronicles 5:12-13; Ephesians 5:19).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the theological significance of sanctifying oneself before bringing up the ark, as seen in 1 Chronicles 15?
options: It signifies holiness and reverence required to approach God
It was a mere ritual with no spiritual importance
It was a way to show social status
It was done to impress the people
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies holiness and reverence required to approach God
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 15:12-14 emphasizes sanctification of priests and Levites before bringing up the ark, illustrating the biblical doctrine of God's holiness and the need for human purity when approaching Him (Leviticus 11:44-45; Hebrews 12:14; 1 Peter 1:15-16).
